### RSAP

The SAPYR package fills the gap for R version > 3.5.2, which resulted after Piers Harding's decision to stop maintaining his great [RSAP package - An R interface to SAP NetWeaver R/3 systems using the RFC protocol][RSAP] which can still be used for R <= 3.5.2. 

### pyRFC

SAPYR wouldn't be possbile without [Srdjan Boskovic's][bsrdjan] great python package [pyRFC - Asynchronous, non-blocking SAP NetWeawer RFC SDK bindings for Python][pyRFC].  

### Reticulate

The python bindings to SAP can be leveraged in R using [Reticulate - calling python from R][reticulate], another great package from [Posit | The Open-Source Data Science Company][POSIT].

### SAP 

The SAP NetWeaver RFC SDK 7.50 provides RFC communication with SAP systems of Release 4.6C and higher. This Software Development Kit is maintained by SAP.  

Information on where to download can be found here [SAP NetWeaver Remote Function Call (RFC)
Software Development Kit (SDK)][nwrfcsdk] or on [me.sap.com/notes/2573790][2573790] (requires a SAP account).

The relevant ABAP modules can be found in SAP using transaction code ```SE16``` for table TFDIR filtered for TFDIR-FMODE = ```R```.
A typical SAP system has about 18K+ remote enabled function modules.
